qas.question: The brain and spinal cord work together to control what system of the body?
What system in the body controls heart rate?
What system in the body controls salivation?
Most of the processes of the autonomic nervous system are called what?
Which system in the body controls urination?

context: In addition to all of the above, the brain and spinal cord contain extensive circuitry to control the <a0_0><a1_0><a2_0>autonomic nervous system<a2_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>, which works by secreting hormones and by modulating the "smooth" muscles of the gut. <a4_0>The autonomic nervous system<a4_0/> affects heart rate, digestion, respiration rate, salivation, perspiration, urination, and sexual arousal, and several other processes. Most of its functions are <a3_0>not under direct voluntary control<a3_0/>.
